member.summary: Specifies how the html content is rendered in a pdf page.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfPageFitMode.NoAdjustment
member.summary: The html content is rendered as it is. No size adjustments are performed, even though the destination space might be smaller than needed.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfPageFitMode.ShrinkOnly
member.summary: The html content is shrunk if necessary to fit the available destination space. This option does not expand the content if it's smaller than the available space.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfPageFitMode.AutoFit
member.summary: The html content is automatically adjusted to fit the entire available space. Unlike , the content can be either shrunk or stretched.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult
member.summary: Offers information about the html to pdf conversion process.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.RectangleF[],SelectPdf.WebPageInformation)
member.summary: Creates a HtmlToPdfResult object.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.PdfPageCount
member.summary: The number of pages in the generated pdf document.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.WebPageSize
member.summary: The size of the web page in pixels.
member.remarks: 1px is 1/96 inch at 96 DPI.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.PdfPageSize
member.summary: The size of the page in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: This size is in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.PdfPageScaleFactor
member.summary: The factor used to scale the html content to fit the pdf page.
member.remarks: This property offers the factor used to scale the html content when rendered into the pdf document. When is or , the html content might be resized to fit the pdf page width if necessary.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.PdfPageLastIndex
member.summary: The index of the pdf page where the rendering of the html content ended in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: This information is useful when other pdf elements are added after conversion using the object.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.PdfPageLastRectangle
member.summary: The size and position of the html content rendered on the last page in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks:
This information is useful when other pdf elements are added after conversion using the object.
Note: The last page is specified by the property.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.PdfPagesRectangles
member.summary: The size and position of the html content rendered in all pages of the pdf document.
member.remarks: This information is useful when other pdf elements are added after conversion using the object.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfResult.WebPageInformation
member.summary: Gets an object populated after conversion with the title, keywords and description of the converted web page.
member.remarks: This information can be used to set the properties of the pdf document after the conversion.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfPageCollection.Add
member.summary: Creates a new pdf page and adds it to the pdf document pages collection.
member.remarks:
If there is a previous page in the pages collection, the orientation and size are inherited from that page, otherwise a first page with the default size and orientation is created.
The page margins are inherited from the default pdf document margins specified in property.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfPageCollection.Add(SelectPdf.PdfMargins)
member.summary: Creates a new pdf page with the specified margins and adds it to the pdf document pages collection.
member.remarks: If there is a previous page in the pages collection, the orientation and size are inherited from that page, otherwise a first page with the default size and orientation is created.
member.param: The pdf page margins.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfPageCollection.Add(SelectPdf.PdfCustomPageSize,SelectPdf.PdfMargins)
member.summary: Creates a new pdf page with the specified size and margins and adds it to the pdf document pages collection.
member.remarks: If there is a previous page in the pages collection, the orientation is inherited from that page, otherwise a first page with the default orientation is created.
member.param: The pdf page size.
The pdf page margins.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfPageCollection.Add(SelectPdf.PdfCustomPageSize,SelectPdf.PdfMargins,SelectPdf.PdfPageOrientation)

member.param: The pdf page size.
The pdf page margins.
The pdf page orientation.

member.param: The index where the new pdf page will be inserted.
The pdf page size.
The pdf page margins.
The pdf page orientation.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfPageCollection.Add(SelectPdf.PdfPage)
member.summary: Adds the specified page to the pdf document pages collection.
member.remarks:
The specified page can belong to another pdf document.
The source pdf document must remain opened until the current document is saved.
member.param: The page to be added to the collection.
member.returns: The index of the page in collection. If the page already exists, this method returns the index of the existing page.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfPageCollection.Add(SelectPdf.PdfPage[])
member.summary: Adds the specified array of pages to the pdf document pages collection.
member.remarks:
The specified pages can belong to another pdf document.
The source pdf document must remain opened until the current document is saved.
member.param: The pdf pages to be added to the collection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width for a custom template.
member.remarks: This property has no effect for a default document template.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height for a custom template.
member.remarks: This property has no effect for a default document template.

member.summary: Gets or sets the template bounds rectangle.
member.remarks: This property has no effect for a default document template.

member.summary: Gets or sets the template docking style inside the pdf page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTemplate.Anchoring
member.summary: Gets or sets the template anchoring settings inside the pdf page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTemplate.DisplayOnOddPages
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the template on the odd numbered pages of the pdf document.
member.remarks: By default the template is displayed on both odd and even numbered pages. The property has priority over .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTemplate.DisplayOnEvenPages
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the template on the even numbered pages of the pdf document.
member.remarks: By default the template is displayed on both odd and even numbered pages.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTemplate.DisplayOnFirstPage
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the template on the first page of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: When this property is true the template will be displayed on the first page of the pdf document, otherwise it will not be visible. This property has priority over . The default value is true.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTemplate.FirstPageNumber
member.summary: Controls the page number for the first page being rendered.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTemplate.TotalPagesOffset
member.summary: Controls the total number of pages offset in the pdf document.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTemplate.Foreground
member.summary: Controls whether the template is rendered in front of the page main content or not.
member.remarks: The default value is true. Elements from the template will be displayed in front of the other elements from the page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTemplate.Background
member.summary: Controls whether the template is rendered behind the page main content or not.
member.remarks: The default value is false. Elements from the template will not be displayed behind the other elements from the page.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.WebElementsMappingOptions
member.summary: Helps retrieving the positions of a list of html elements in the generated pdf document.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.WebElementsMappingOptions.CssSelectors
member.summary: This property is used to set an array containing the selectors of the HTML elements for which to retrieve position in PDF. For example, the selector for all the image elements is "img", the selector for all the elements with the CSS class name 'myclass' is "*.myclass" and the selector for the elements with the id 'myid' is "*#myid". The elements mapping will be retrieved in the Result property after conversion.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.WebElementsMappingOptions.Result
member.summary: This property is set automatically after conversion and returns the mapping into the generated pdf document of the html elements specified by the CssSelectors.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.HiddenWebElements
member.summary: Helps defining a set of html elements that will not be displayed in the generated pdf document.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HiddenWebElements.CssSelectors
member.summary: This property is used to define an array containing the selectors of the html elements that will not be displayed in the final pdf document. For example, the selector for all the image elements is "img", the selector for all the elements with the CSS class name 'myclass' is "*.myclass" and the selector for the elements with the id 'myid' is "*#myid".

member.summary: Creates a html object that can be added to the header or footer templates of a pdf document.
member.remarks:
The html element is specified in this case by a html string. The html will be converted and rendered at the (0,0) location in the pdf header or footer. The width of the element in pdf is the available width in pdf page and the height is auto determined.
The web page is rendered in an internal browser with the default width of 1024px and height auto determined. This can be changed using the and properties.

This parameter allows the converter to resolve relative urls. Basically, baseUrl + relative image/css url = full absolute url.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.WebPageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the converted web page as it would appear in the internal browser used to render the html.
member.remarks:
The web page width is specified in pixels and the default value is 1024px. The page width is only an indication of the minimum page width recommended for conversion. If the content does not fit this width, the converter will automatically resize the internal browser to fit the whole html content. To avoid this, the property needs to be set to true. When is true, the web page will be rendered with the specified and even though the content might be truncated.
If is set to 0, the converter will automatically determine the page width, finding the width that will fit the html content.
This property can also be set directly in the constructor of class.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.WebPageHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the converted web page as it would appear in the internal browser used to render the html.
member.remarks:
The web page height is specified in pixels and the default value is 0px. This means that the converter will automatically calculate the page height.
Generally this property does not need to be changed, but there are situations when the converter cannot calculate correctly the web page height (for example for web pages with frames) and in that case, needs to be set, otherwise no content might appear in the generated pdf.
Note: If the is set, the content that exceeds this page height is truncated and will not appear in the generated pdf document. Only using the default 0 value will allow the whole page content to be rendered all the time in the generated pdf document.
This property can also be set directly in the constructor of class.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.WebPageFixedSize
member.summary: Controls whether the web page is rendered with a fixed size internal browser or the size automatically extends to make the whole content visible.
member.remarks:
The default value of this property is false.
If the web page does not fit the dimensions specified by the and properties and is set to false, the converter will try to automatically calculate a larger width and height to be able to display the whole html content.
If is set to true, this will indicate the converter not to calculate another width and height, but use width and height specified by and . These dimensions with be used even though the content will not fit the available space and it will be truncated.
Note: If is set to true, a page height needs to be set using , because the default value (0) will make the converter fail (cannot render a web page with no height).

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.VisibleWebElementId
member.summary: Use this property to convert only a certain section of the page, specified by the html element ID.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.StartupMode
member.summary: Use this property to specify how the conversion starts.
member.remarks: By default this is set to and the conversion is started as soon as the page loads (and elapses). If set to , the conversion is started only by a javascript call to SelectPdf.startConversion() from within the web page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.StartupScript
member.summary: Use this property to specify some JavaScript code that will be injected into the page that is converted.
member.remarks: The JavaScript code specified here will run before any other script on the page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.KeepTextsTogether
member.summary: This property instructs the converter whether to try to avoid cutting off the text lines between pdf pages or not.
member.remarks: The default value is true and the converter tries to avoid text cutting between pdf pages.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.KeepImagesTogether
member.summary: This property instructs the converter whether to try to avoid cutting off the images between pdf pages or not.
member.remarks: The default value is false and the converter does not try to avoid images cutting between pdf pages.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.AutoFitWidth
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal auto fit mode.
member.remarks:
The converter considers both and when the html content is rendered in the pdf page or specified rectangle.
If this property is set to , the html content is not resized horizontally in any way to fit the available space. If the content is larger, it will be cut and not all of it will be displayed in the generated pdf file.
If this property is set to , the html content is resized only if the content width is larger than the destination space (pdf page or rectangle) width. In this case, the content is shrunk to fit the destination space width and the elements that it contains (texts, images) will appear smaller in the generated pdf document than in the original web page. If the original content width is smaller than the destination width, no adjustments will be done and the content will be rendered exactly as it is, even though some additional white space might appear to its right.
If this property is set to , the html content is resized to fit the available width of the destination space. If the original content width is smaller than the destination width, the elements rendered (texts, images) will appear larger in the generated pdf document. If the original content width is larger than the destination width, the elements rendered (texts, images) will appear smaller in the generated pdf document.
The default value of this property is .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.AutoFitHeight
member.summary: Specifies the vertical auto fit mode.
member.remarks:
The converter considers both and when the html content is rendered in the pdf page or specified rectangle.
If this property is set to , the html content is not resized vertically in any way to fit the available space. If the content is larger, it will be cut and not all of it will be displayed in the generated pdf file.
If this property is set to , the html content is resized only if the content height is larger than the destination space (pdf page or rectangle) height. In this case, the content is shrunk to fit the destination space height and the elements that it contains (texts, images) will appear smaller in the generated pdf document than in the original web page. If the original content height is smaller than the destination height, no adjustments will be done and the content will be rendered exactly as it is, even though some additional white space might appear at the bottom.
If this property is set to , the converter will treat it like .
The default value of this property is and for rendering, the converter will only take into consideration.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.DrawBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the web page background is rendered in pdf.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is true and the page background is rendered into the generated pdf. Even though it might be white, it will still make invisible any pdf element that was rendered behind it. Setting this property to false can make visible the existing pdf elements behind this html element.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: Enable scripts when rendering the url or html string.
member.remarks:
The default value of this property is true and the converter will run any javascript available when the page loads.
Note: If the javascript requires some time to load, property should be set to delay the conversion with the specified number of seconds and allow the javascript to run.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.PluginsEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if plugins (like Flash players) are enabled in the converter.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is true.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.CssMediaType
member.summary: Indicates what css styles are used when the web page is rendered.
member.remarks: The default value is and the page is rendered like in a regular web browser. If the page contains printer specific styles, the property should be set to to have the page rendered using those css styles.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.EmbedFonts
member.summary: Instructs the converter to embed all the needed fonts into the pdf document or not.
member.remarks:
The default value for this property is false and the fonts are not automatically embedded.
This property does not control the web fonts (fonts that are downloaded with the web page). The web fonts are always embedded because they are not installed on the machine.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.MinPageLoadTime
member.summary: An additional time in seconds to wait for asynchronous items to be loaded before the web page is rendered.
member.remarks: A delay of this type could be necessary if javascripts are loaded when the page is rendered or if Flash movies are played.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.MaxPageLoadTime
member.summary: The web page navigation timeout in seconds.
member.remarks: Default value is 60 seconds. This value should be increased if large web pages are loaded.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.HttpCookies
member.summary: Gets the collection of custom HTTP cookies used for the conversion.
member.remarks: This property returns a reference to the collection of custom HTTP cookies to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is rendered. A cookie is defined by a name/value pair that can be added to the collection using the method of the property.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.HttpHeaders
member.summary: Get the collection of custom HTTP headers used for the conversion.
member.remarks: This property returns a reference to the collection of custom HTTP headers to be sent by the converter to the web server when the web page is rendered. A custom HTTP header is defined by a name/value pair that can be added to the collection using the method of the property.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object containing the proxy settings used to access the web page that is being converted.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.ExternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: Controls the rendering of external hyperlinks in pdf.
member.remarks:
The default value for this property is true and in this case all external hyperlinks from the web page will be rendered in the generated pdf document.
When this property is set to false, external links are ignore and they do not appear in the generated pdf document.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: Controls the conversion of internal html links to internal pdf links.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is true and in this case all internal hyperlinks from the web page (links that point within the web page) will be rendered in the generated pdf document as internal pdf links (clicking one of them will jump within the pdf document).

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection.Authentication
member.summary: Handles authentication options if the web page being converted requires authentication.

member.summary: Use this property to specify how the conversion starts.
member.remarks: By default this is set to and the conversion is started as soon as the page loads (and elapses). If set to , the conversion is started only by a javascript call to SelectPdf.startConversion() from within the web page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToImage.WebPageFixedSize
member.summary: Controls whether the web page is rendered with a fixed size internal browser or the size automatically extends to make the whole content visible.
member.remarks:
If the html content is not entirely visible in the web page viewer (browser) at the specified width, this property will control whether the html content is clipped or the web page browser width is automatically extended to make visible the whole html content.
The html browser width is given by the property.
The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToImage.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: Enable scripts when rendering the url or html string.
member.remarks:
The default value of this property is true and the converter will run any javascript available when the page loads.
Note: If the javascript requires some time to load, property should be set to delay the conversion with the specified number of seconds and allow the javascript to run.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdf
member.summary: Html To Pdf Converter. This class offers the API needed to convert any web page url or html string to pdf.
member.remarks: The result of conversion is a object that can be further modified, saved to memory or into a file on the disk.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdf.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the HtmlToPdf Converter.
member.remarks:
The web page is rendered by an internal browser having the default width of 1024px. The height of the page is automatically calculated. The width and height can be set using and properties of property.
Usually, the web page width and height do not need to be set and the converter automatically calculates them, but there are some situations (web pages with frames for example) when the converter cannot calculate the page size correctly. In this case, the web page width and height needs to be set, otherwise no content will appear in the generated pdf document.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdf.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the HtmlToPdf Converter.
member.remarks:
The web page is rendered by an internal browser having the width specified by the webPageWidth parameter and the height automatically calculated. The width and height can be also set using and properties of property.
Usually, the web page height does not need to be set and the converter automatically calculates it, but there are some situations (web pages with frames for example) when the converter cannot calculate the page height correctly. In this case, the web page needs to be set, otherwise no content will appear in the generated pdf document.
member.param: Width in pixels of the internal browser that renders the web page.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdf.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the HtmlToPdf Converter.
member.remarks:
The web page is rendered by an internal browser having the width specified by the webPageWidth parameter and the height of the page specified by the webPageHeight parameter. The width and height can be also set using and properties of property.
If webPageHeight is set, the web page will be truncated to the specified height. Usually, webPageHeight should be set to 0 to determine the converter to automatically calculate the page height, but there are some situations (web pages with frames for example) when the converter cannot calculate the page height correctly. In this case, webPageHeight needs to be set, otherwise no content will appear in the generated pdf document.
member.param: Width in pixels of the internal browser that renders the web page.
Height in pixels of the internal browser that renders the web page.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConvertUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a object representing the result of the conversion of the specified url to pdf.
member.remarks: The resulted object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
member.param: The full url of the web page to be converted to pdf. The url can be also the full path of a html file from the local file system.
member.returns: The object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConvertHtmlString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a object representing the result of the conversion of the specified html string to pdf.
member.remarks:
The resulted object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
This method does not use any base url and therefore the images or css files referenced by relative urls in the html string cannot be resolved by the converter to an absolute url. If there are external resources referenced by relative urls, the method with the baseUrl additional parameter should be used.
member.param: The html string to be converted to pdf.
member.returns: The object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdf.ConvertHtmlString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a object representing the result of the conversion of the specified html string to pdf.
member.remarks:
The resulted object can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response. The object must be closed after save to release the system resources used during conversion.
The baseUrl parameter allows the converter to determine the full absolute urls from relative urls for images and css files appearing in the html string.
member.param: The html string to be converted to pdf.
This parameter allows the converter to resolve relative urls. Basically, baseUrl + relative image/css url = full absolute url.
member.returns: The object that can be modified and saved to a file, to a stream, to a memory buffer or to a HTTP response.

member.remarks: This property can be used to control the generated pdf header, footer, margins, page size and orientation, compression level, content resizing and many more. Check for complete details.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions
member.summary: This class contains various options used for the html to pdf conversion.
member.remarks: The class defines a reference to an object of this type.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.MarginLeft
member.summary: The left margin of the pdf document.
member.remarks: The margin is specified in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.MarginRight
member.summary: The right margin of the pdf document.
member.remarks: The margin is specified in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.MarginTop
member.summary: The top margin of the pdf document.
member.remarks: The margin is specified in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.MarginBottom
member.summary: The bottom margin of the pdf document.
member.remarks: The margin is specified in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.PdfCompressionLevel
member.summary: This property controls the compression level of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: The default value is .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated pdf document. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated pdf is lower than the quality of the original images from the web page, and this quality depends on the parameter. When the is increased, the quality of the images in pdf decreases.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level of images in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks:
This property can take values between 0 and 100. It has effect only when the is set to true. When the is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst.
The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in pdf.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.PdfPageSize
member.summary: This property controls the size of the generated document pages.
member.remarks: The default size of the pdf document pages is . When this property is set to , a custom size can be specified for the generated pdf document pages using the property.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.PdfPageCustomSize
member.summary: This property can be used to specify a custom pdf document page size.
member.remarks: The property is taken into account only when property is set to . The custom width and height of the pdf page is specified in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.AutoFitWidth
member.summary: Specifies the html content horizontal auto fit mode.
member.remarks:
The converter considers both and when the html content is rendered in the pdf page or specified rectangle.
If this property is set to , the html content is not resized horizontally in any way to fit the available space. If the content is larger, it will be cut and not all of it will be displayed in the generated pdf file.
If this property is set to , the html content is resized only if the content width is larger than the destination space (pdf page or rectangle) width. In this case, the content is shrunk to fit the destination space width and the elements that it contains (texts, images) will appear smaller in the generated pdf document than in the original web page. If the original content width is smaller than the destination width, no adjustments will be done and the content will be rendered exactly as it is, even though some additional white space might appear to its right.
If this property is set to , the html content is resized to fit the available width of the destination space. If the original content width is smaller than the destination width, the elements rendered (texts, images) will appear larger in the generated pdf document. If the original content width is larger than the destination width, the elements rendered (texts, images) will appear smaller in the generated pdf document.
The default value of this property is .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.AutoFitHeight
member.summary: Specifies the html content vertical auto fit mode.
member.remarks:
The converter considers both and when the html content is rendered in the pdf page or specified rectangle.
If this property is set to , the html content is not resized vertically in any way to fit the available space. If the content is larger, it will be cut and not all of it will be displayed in the generated pdf file.
If this property is set to , the html content is resized only if the content height is larger than the destination space (pdf page or rectangle) height. In this case, the content is shrunk to fit the destination space height and the elements that it contains (texts, images) will appear smaller in the generated pdf document than in the original web page. If the original content height is smaller than the destination height, no adjustments will be done and the content will be rendered exactly as it is, even though some additional white space might appear at the bottom.
If this property is set to , the converter will treat it like .
The default value of this property is and for rendering, the converter will only take into consideration.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.PdfPageOrientation
member.summary: This property controls the page orientation of the generated pdf document pages.
member.remarks: The default pdf page orientation is .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.DisplayHeader
member.summary: Controls if a custom header is displayed in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks:
The header properties can be customized using the object exposed by property of the converter class.
Note: The default value of this property is false and the generated pdf document will not have a custom header.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.DisplayFooter
member.summary: Controls if a custom footer is displayed in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks:
The footer properties can be customized using the object exposed by property of the converter class.
Note: The default value of this property is false and the generated pdf document will not have a custom footer.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.EmbedFonts
member.summary: Instructs the converter to embed all the needed fonts into the pdf document or not.
member.remarks:
The default value for this property is false and the fonts are not automatically embedded.
This property does not control the web fonts (fonts that are downloaded with the web page). The web fonts are always embedded because they are not installed on the machine.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.ExternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: Controls the rendering of external hyperlinks in pdf.
member.remarks:
The default value for this property is true and in this case all external hyperlinks from the web page will be rendered in the generated pdf document.
When this property is set to false, external links are ignore and they do not appear in the generated pdf document.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.InternalLinksEnabled
member.summary: Controls the conversion of internal html links to internal pdf links.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is true and in this case all internal hyperlinks from the web page (links that point within the web page) will be rendered in the generated pdf document as internal pdf links (clicking one of them will jump within the pdf document).

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.WebPageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the converted web page as it would appear in the internal browser used to render the html.
member.remarks:
The web page width is specified in pixels and the default value is 1024px. The page width is only an indication of the minimum page width recommended for conversion. If the content does not fit this width, the converter will automatically resize the internal browser to fit the whole html content. To avoid this, the property needs to be set to true. When is true, the web page will be rendered with the specified and even though the content might be truncated.
If is set to 0, the converter will automatically determine the page width, finding the width that will fit the html content.
This property can also be set directly in the constructor of class.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.WebPageHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the converted web page as it would appear in the internal browser used to render the html.
member.remarks:
The web page height is specified in pixels and the default value is 0px. This means that the converter will automatically calculate the page height.
Generally this property does not need to be changed, but there are situations when the converter cannot calculate correctly the web page height (for example for web pages with frames) and in that case, needs to be set, otherwise no content might appear in the generated pdf.
Note: If the is set, the content that exceeds this page height is truncated and will not appear in the generated pdf document. Only using the default 0 value will allow the whole page content to be rendered all the time in the generated pdf document.
This property can also be set directly in the constructor of class.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.WebPageFixedSize
member.summary: Controls whether the web page is rendered with a fixed size internal browser or the size automatically extends to make the whole content visible.
member.remarks:
The default value of this property is false.
If the web page does not fit the dimensions specified by the and properties and is set to false, the converter will try to automatically calculate a larger width and height to be able to display the whole html content.
If is set to true, this will indicate the converter not to calculate another width and height, but use width and height specified by and . These dimensions with be used even though the content will not fit the available space and it will be truncated.
Note: If is set to true, a page height needs to be set using , because the default value (0) will make the converter fail (cannot render a web page with no height).

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.VisibleWebElementId
member.summary: Use this property to convert only a certain section of the page, specified by the html element ID.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.StartupMode
member.summary: Use this property to specify how the conversion starts.
member.remarks: By default this is set to and the conversion is started as soon as the page loads (and elapses). If set to , the conversion is started only by a javascript call to SelectPdf.startConversion() from within the web page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.StartupScript
member.summary: Use this property to specify some JavaScript code that will be injected into the page that is converted.
member.remarks: The JavaScript code specified here will run before any other script on the page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.KeepTextsTogether
member.summary: This property instructs the converter whether to try to avoid cutting off the text lines between pdf pages or not.
member.remarks: The default value is true and the converter tries to avoid text cutting between pdf pages.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.KeepImagesTogether
member.summary: This property instructs the converter whether to try to avoid cutting off the images between pdf pages or not.
member.remarks: The default value is false and the converter does not try to avoid images cutting between pdf pages.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.JavaScriptEnabled
member.summary: Enable scripts when rendering the url or html string.
member.remarks:
The default value of this property is true and the converter will run any javascript available when the page loads.
Note: If the javascript requires some time to load, property should be set to delay the conversion with the specified number of seconds and allow the javascript to run.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.PluginsEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if plugins (like Flash players) are enabled in the converter.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is true.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.CssMediaType
member.summary: Indicates what css styles are used when the web page is rendered.
member.remarks: The default value is and the page is rendered like in a regular web browser. If the page contains printer specific styles, the property should be set to to have the page rendered using those css styles.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.RenderPageOnTimeout
member.summary: A flag indicating if the page is rendered even if a navigation timeout occurs. The default value is False and a navigation timeout exception is raised.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.DrawBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the web page background is rendered in pdf.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is true and the page background is rendered into the generated pdf. Even though it might be white, it will still make invisible any pdf element that was rendered behind it. Setting this property to false can make visible the existing pdf elements behind this html element.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.HiddenWebElements
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that controls the visibility of some web elements in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: This property needs to be set to instruct the html to pdf converter to hide some elements from the web page and not render them in the pdf document. The converter will not render the web elements specified by the of the property.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.ViewerPreferences
member.summary: Controls how the pdf document will appear in a pdf viewer (like Adobe Reader).

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.ProxyOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object containing the proxy settings used to access the web page that is being converted.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.PdfStandard
member.summary: Defines the pdf standard used by the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: The default value is and in this case the full set of pdf features can be used in the generated document. This property can be used to instruct the converter to generate PDF/A, PDF/X or PDF/SiqQ compliant documents.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the color space of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: The possible values are , or . The default color space is .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfOptions.MaximumConcurrentConversions
member.summary: Maximum number of html to pdf conversions that can be performed simultaneously.
member.remarks:
This parameter must be set before the first conversion performed by the application. When this property is set with a negative value or zero, the concurrency level is maximum. The default value is 4.
If the maximum number is reached and more conversion requests arrive, they will wait in a queue for an available spot.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.PdfDestinationFitMode
member.summary: Specifies the auto-fit mode for a object.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfDestinationFitMode.None
member.summary: Does not try to automatically fit the page.
member.remarks: Displays the page specified, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfDestinationFitMode.EntirePage
member.summary: Automatically fits the entire page.
member.remarks: Displays the page specified, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfDestinationFitMode.EntirePageWidth
member.summary: Automatically fits the entire width of the page.
member.remarks: Displays the page specified, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfDestinationFitMode.EntirePageHeight
member.summary: Automatically fits the entire height of the page.
member.remarks: Displays the page specified, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfDestinationFitMode.BoundingBox
member.summary: Automatically fits the bounding box.
member.remarks: Displays the page specified, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfDestinationFitMode.BoundingBoxWidth
member.summary: Automatically fits the entire bounding box width of the page.
member.remarks: Displays the page specified, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfDestinationFitMode.BoundingBoxHeight
member.summary: Automatically fits the entire bounding box height of the page.
member.remarks: Displays the page specified, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.PdfDocument
member.summary: Represents a pdf document.
member.remarks: This class provides the API to create, load, modify and save a pdf document.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty pdf document object.
member.remarks: New pdf pages can be added to the document and new pdf elements can be added to these new document pages.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.#ctor(SelectPdf.PdfStandard)
member.summary: Creates an empty pdf document object.
member.param: Defines the pdf standard used by the generated pdf document. The default value is and in this case the full set of pdf features can be used in the generated document. This parameter can be used to generate PDF/A, PDF/X or PDF/SiqQ compliant documents.
member.remarks: New pdf pages can be added to the document and new pdf elements can be added to these new document pages.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads a pdf document from the specified stream.
member.param: The pdf document stream.

member.summary: Loads a pdf document from an existing pdf file.
member.param: The full path to the existing pdf document file.

member.summary: Loads a pdf document from a stream containing a password protected pdf document.
member.remarks: The specified password can be a user or owner password.
member.param: The stream containing the pdf document.
The password to open the specified pdf document.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a pdf document from an existing password protected pdf file.
member.param: The full path to the existing pdf file.
The password to open the specified pdf document.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.Close
member.summary: Closes the current pdf document.
member.remarks:
Calling this method will release all the resources allocated by the pdf document.
Always call this method after the document was saved.
If the document was created from a stream, the stream will be closed if it was not explicitly detached by calling the before the document is closed.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.DetachStream
member.summary: Detaches the stream that was used to load the pdf document, leaving it open in case the current pdf document is closed.
member.remarks: Call this method to detach the stream from which the pdf document was created. When this method is called before calling , the method will not close the detached stream.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the pdf document to the specified file.
member.param: The name of the file where to save the document. It can be a full path or a relative path.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.Save(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the pdf document to the specified stream.
member.param: The stream where to save the pdf document.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.Save
member.summary: Saves the pdf document as byte array.
member.remarks: The byte array can be further saved to a file or sent over HTTP as a response to the browser.
member.returns: The byte array representation of the document.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.Save(System.Web.HttpResponse,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the pdf document to a HTTP stream.
member.param: The HTTP response object.
If this is true, the pdf document will be automatically opened in browser, otherwise the user will be asked to save or open the downloaded pdf document.
The name of the pdf document. This name is used by the browser when it opens the pdf document inline or the name suggested for saving the document when the document is sent as an attachment.

member.summary: The action to be performed when the pdf document is opened.
member.remarks:
The pdf document can perform 2 types of actions when it is opened:
- The pdf document opens at a specific .
- The pdf document will run a specific javascript.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the pdf document compression level.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated pdf document. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated pdf is lower than the quality of the original images from the web page, and this quality depends on the parameter. When the is increased, the quality of the images in pdf decreases.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfDocument.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level of images in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks:
This property can take values between 0 and 100. It has effect only when the is set to true. When the is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst.
The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in pdf.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.PdfTemplateAnchoring

member.summary: The template will be anchored in the center of the pdf page.

member.summary: The template will be anchored in the top right corner of the pdf page.

member.summary: The template will be anchored in the bottom left corner of the pdf page.
member.remarks: The left side of the template will be aligned with the left side of the page and the bottom side of the document will be aligned with the bottom side of the page.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfTemplateAnchoring.BottomRight
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the bottom left corner of the pdf page.
member.remarks: The right side of the document will be aligned with the right side of the pdf page and the bottom side of the document will be aligned with the bottom side of the PDF page

The footer space is automatically taken into account when calculating the available space for rendering in a pdf page.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTextSection.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets an angle to control the text direction.
member.remarks: The default value is 0. Adding a value in degrees will rotate the text counter-clockwise.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTextSection.TextRise
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance to move the text baseline up or down from its default location.
member.remarks:
Adjustments to the baseline are useful for drawing superscripts or subscripts.
Positive values of text rise move the baseline up and creates a superscript text.
Negative values of text rise move the baseline down and creates a subscript text.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTextSection.BackColor

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTextSection.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the element foreground color.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfTextSection.Text
member.summary: The text string that will be added to the pdf document header or footer.
member.remarks:
If {page_number} placeholder appears in this property, it will be replaced with the current pdf page number. By default the page numbering starts with 1. This can be changed using the property.
If {total_pages} placeholder appears in this property, it will be replaced with the total number of pages in the generated pdf document. The total number of pages can be incremented with a value specified by the property. This could be useful when the generated pdf will be merged with other documents.

member.remarks:
The transparency is expressed as a value between 0 and 100.
The value 0 means completely transparent and 100 means completely opaque.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.PdfFooter
member.summary: Handles the properties of the footer of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks:
This class encapsulates the options to control the footer in the rendered pdf document. The class contains a reference to an object of this type.
The footer is displayed only if property of the object is true. If the property of the object is false, the footer will not be displayed and all the options set here will have no effect.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.Add(SelectPdf.PdfSectionElement)
member.summary: Adds an additional element to the footer of the pdf document.
member.remarks: There are 3 section elements that can be added to the footer of the pdf document: , and .
member.param: The element that will be rendered in the pdf footer.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.AddTextArea(SelectPdf.PdfTextSection)
member.summary: Adds a TextArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined footer elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The TextArea object to be rendered.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.AddImageArea(SelectPdf.PdfImageSection)
member.summary: Adds an ImageArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined footer elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The ImageArea object to be rendered.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.AddHtmlToPdfArea(SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection)
member.summary: Adds a PdfHtmlSection element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined footer elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The PdfHtmlSection object to be rendered.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.Height
member.summary: The height of the pdf document footer.
member.remarks: This height is specified in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch. The default value is 35pt.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.FirstPageNumber
member.summary: Controls the page number for the first page being rendered.
member.remarks: The page number is displayed setting a {page_number} placeholder in the property. By default the page numbers start with 1. This can be changed using the property.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.TotalPagesOffset
member.summary: Controls the total number of pages offset in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: The total number of pages is displayed setting a {total_pages} placeholder in the property. The total number of pages can be incremented with a value specified by the property. This could be useful when the generated pdf will be merged with other documents.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.DisplayOnFirstPage
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the footer on the first page of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: When this property is true the footer will be displayed on the first page of the pdf document, otherwise it will not be visible. This property has priority over . The default value is true.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.DisplayOnOddPages
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the footer on the odd numbered pages of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: By default the footer is displayed on both odd and even numbered pages. The property has priority over .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfFooter.DisplayOnEvenPages
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the footer on the even numbered pages of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: By default the footer is displayed on both odd and even numbered pages.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.PdfHeader
member.summary: Handles the properties of the header of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks:
This class encapsulates the options to control the header in the rendered pdf document. The class contains a reference to an object of this type.
The header is displayed only if property of the object is true. If the property of the object is false, the header will not be displayed and all the options set here will have no effect.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.Add(SelectPdf.PdfSectionElement)
member.summary: Adds an additional element to the header of the pdf document.
member.remarks: There are 3 section elements that can be added to the header of the pdf document: , and .
member.param: The element that will be rendered in the pdf header.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.AddTextArea(SelectPdf.PdfTextSection)
member.summary: Adds a TextArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined header elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The TextArea object to be rendered.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.AddImageArea(SelectPdf.PdfImageSection)
member.summary: Adds an ImageArea element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined header elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The ImageArea object to be rendered.

member.name: M:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.AddHtmlToPdfArea(SelectPdf.PdfHtmlSection)
member.summary: Adds a PdfHtmlSection element to the additional elements list rendered after the predefined header elements. The additional elements are rendered in the order they are added to the list.
member.param: The PdfHtmlSection object to be rendered.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.Height
member.summary: The height of the pdf document header.
member.remarks: This height is specified in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch. The default value is 45pt.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.FirstPageNumber
member.summary: Controls the page number for the first page being rendered.
member.remarks: The page number is displayed setting a {page_number} placeholder in the property. By default the page numbers start with 1. This can be changed using the property.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.TotalPagesOffset
member.summary: Controls the total number of pages offset in the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: The total number of pages is displayed setting a {total_pages} placeholder in the property. The total number of pages can be incremented with a value specified by the property. This could be useful when the generated pdf will be merged with other documents.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.DisplayOnFirstPage
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the header on the first page of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: When this property is true the header will be displayed on the first page of the pdf document, otherwise it will not be visible. This property has priority over . The default value is true.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.DisplayOnOddPages
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the header on the odd numbered pages of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: By default the header is displayed on both odd and even numbered pages. The property has priority over .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfHeader.DisplayOnEvenPages
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the header on the even numbered pages of the generated pdf document.
member.remarks: By default the header is displayed on both odd and even numbered pages.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: This class provides the options to control the pdf document security.
member.remarks: The class defines a reference to an object of this type.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanAssembleDocument
member.summary: Allows inserting, rotating or deleting pages or bookmarks.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanCopyContent
member.summary: Allows copying page contents such as text and images.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanEditAnnotations
member.summary: Allows document annotations editing.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanEditContent
member.summary: Allows modifying document content.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanFillFormFields
member.summary: Allows filling in form fields.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanPrint
member.summary: Allows printing.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Sets or gets the owner password.
member.remarks: This password is required to change permissions of the pdf document (like printing or editing).

member.name: P:SelectPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.UserPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the user password.
member.remarks: This password is required to open the pdf document.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.PdfStandard
member.summary: The list of pdf standards available.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfStandard.Full
member.summary: The full pdf features can be used in the generated pdf document.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfStandard.PdfA
member.summary: The generated pdf is in conformance with PDF/A standard which makes the document suitable for long term archiving.
member.remarks: All the true type fonts are embedded in the pdf document, external HTTP links are disabled, transparencies are disabled, and some special metadata to identify the document as PDF/A compliant is inserted in the generated pdf document.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfStandard.PdfX
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/X standard which makes the document suitable for graphics exchange.
member.remarks: In PDF/X all the true type fonts are embedded in the generated pdf document.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfStandard.PdfSiqQLevelA
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/SiqQ Level A standard which makes the document suitable for being digitally signed.
member.remarks: In PDF/SiqQ Level A all the true type fonts are embedded in the pdf document and the external HTTP links are disabled.

member.name: F:SelectPdf.PdfStandard.PdfSiqQLevelB
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/SiqQ Level B standard which makes the document suitable for being digitally signed.
member.remarks: In PDF/SiqQ Level A all the true type fonts are embedded in the generated pdf document.

member.name: T:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences
member.summary: The pdf viewer preferences. Controls how the pdf document appears in a pdf viewer (like Adobe Reader).

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.HideToolbar
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether to hide the pdf viewer application's tool bars when the document is active.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is false.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.HideMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether to hide the pdf viewer application's menu bar when the document is active.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is false.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the document's window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document's contents displayed.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is false.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether to resize the document's window to fit the size of the first displayed page.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is false.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.CenterWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether to position the document's window in the center of the screen.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is false.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying whether the window's title bar should display the document title taken from property.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is false.

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the document page mode when the pdf viewer application exits the full screen mode.
member.remarks:
This property is taken into account only if is set to . Otherwise it is ignored.
The default value for this property is .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.PageMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the document page mode when the pdf document is opened in a pdf viewer.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is .

member.name: P:SelectPdf.HtmlToPdfViewerPreferences.PageLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the page layout to be used when the document is opened.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is .
